intro: Strobilanthes longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and striking violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and grasslands. It produces distinctive bract-based inflorescences that are often adorned with showy, tubular flowers. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
